summary: The 'Building Resiliency and Understanding of Shrublands to Halt Fires Act' (BRUSH Fires Act) directs the Secretary of Agriculture to conduct a study on wildfire mitigation methods in shrubland ecosystems (chaparral, sagebrush, etc.). The study will evaluate the effectiveness of various methods, including hazardous fuels management and ecosystem health maintenance, and assess factors that influence their effectiveness. A report summarizing the study's findings, best practices, and areas for further research will be submitted to Congress. The bill aims to improve wildfire resilience and reduce the risk of harm to communities within or adjacent to these ecosystems.
